verses.verse: Afterward <S%H310><s%> <S%H3651><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> opened <S%H6605><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> and cursed <S%H7043><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> of his [birth.]
"Let the day <S%H3117><s%> perish on which I was to be born, <S%H6><s%> And the night <S%H3205><s%> [which] said, <S%H3915><s%> 'A boy <S%H559><s%> is conceived. <S%H1397><s%>'
"May that day <S%H3117><s%> be darkness; <S%H2822><s%> Let not God <S%H433><s%> above <S%H4605><s%> care <S%H1875><s%> for it, Nor <S%H408><s%> light <S%H5105><s%> shine <S%H3313><s%> on it.

"Let darkness <S%H2822><s%> and black <S%H6757><s%> gloom <S%H6757><s%> claim <S%H1350><s%> it; Let a cloud <S%H6053><s%> settle <S%H7931><s%> on it; Let the blackness <S%H3650><s%> of the day <S%H3117><s%> terrify <S%H1204><s%> it.

"[As for] that night, <S%H3915><s%> let darkness <S%H652><s%> seize <S%H3947><s%> it; Let it not rejoice <S%H2302><s%> among the days <S%H3117><s%> of the year; <S%H8141><s%> Let it not come <S%H935><s%> into the number <S%H4557><s%> of the months. <S%H3391><s%>
"Behold, <S%H2009><s%> let that night <S%H3915><s%> be barren; <S%H1565><s%> Let no <S%H408><s%> joyful <S%H7445><s%> shout <S%H7445><s%> enter <S%H935><s%> it.
"Let those curse <S%H6895><s%> it who curse <S%H779><s%> the day, <S%H3117><s%> Who are prepared <S%H6264><s%> to rouse <S%H5782><s%> Leviathan. <S%H3882><s%>

"Let the stars <S%H3556><s%> of its twilight <S%H5399><s%> be darkened; <S%H2821><s%> Let it wait <S%H6960><s%> for light <S%H216><s%> but have <S%H369><s%> none, <S%H369><s%> Neither <S%H408><s%> let it see <S%H7200><s%> the breaking <S%H6079><s%> dawn; <S%H7837><s%>
Because <S%H3588><s%> it did not shut <S%H5462><s%> the opening <S%H1817><s%> of my [mother's] womb, <S%H990><s%> Or hide <S%H5641><s%> trouble <S%H5999><s%> from my eyes. <S%H5869><s%>
"Why <S%H4100><s%> did I not die <S%H4191><s%> at birth, <S%H7358><s%> Come <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> from the womb <S%H990><s%> and expire <S%H1478><s%>?
"Why <S%H4069><s%> did the knees <S%H1290><s%> receive <S%H6923><s%> me, And why <S%H4100><s%> the breasts, <S%H7699><s%> that I should suck <S%H3243><s%>?

"For now <S%H6258><s%> I would have lain <S%H7901><s%> down <S%H7901><s%> and been <S%H8252><s%> quiet; <S%H8252><s%> I would have slept <S%H3462><s%> then, <S%H227><s%> I would have been <S%H5117><s%> at rest, <S%H5117><s%>
With kings <S%H4428><s%> and [with] counselors <S%H3289><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> Who rebuilt <S%H1129><s%> ruins <S%H2723><s%> for themselves;
Or <S%H176><s%> with princes <S%H8269><s%> who had gold, <S%H2091><s%> Who were filling <S%H4390><s%> their houses <S%H1004><s%> [with] silver. <S%H3701><s%>
"Or <S%H176><s%> like a miscarriage <S%H5309><s%> which is discarded, <S%H2934><s%> I would not be, As infants <S%H5768><s%> that never <S%H3808><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> light. <S%H216><s%>
"There <S%H8033><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> cease <S%H2308><s%> from raging, <S%H7267><s%> And there <S%H8033><s%> the weary <S%H3019><s%> are at rest. <S%H5117><s%>
"The prisoners <S%H615><s%> are at ease <S%H7599><s%> together; <S%H3162><s%> They do not hear <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the taskmaster. <S%H5065><s%>
"The small <S%H9512><s%> and the great <S%H1419><s%> are there, <S%H8033><s%> And the slave <S%H5650><s%> is free <S%H2670><s%> from his master. <S%H113><s%>
"Why <S%H4100><s%> is light <S%H216><s%> given <S%H5414><s%> to him who <S%H9416><s%> suffers, <S%H9416><s%> And life <S%H9132><s%> to the bitter <S%H4751><s%> of soul; <S%H5315><s%>

Who long <S%H2442><s%> for death, <S%H4194><s%> but there <S%H369><s%> is none, <S%H369><s%> And dig <S%H2658><s%> for it more <S%H4480><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> for hidden <S%H4301><s%> treasures; <S%H4301><s%>
Who rejoice <S%H8056><s%> greatly, <S%H413><s%> <S%H1524><s%> They exult <S%H7797><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> they find <S%H4672><s%> the grave <S%H6913><s%>?
"[Why is light given] to a man <S%H1397><s%> whose <S%H834><s%> way <S%H1870><s%> is hidden, <S%H5641><s%> And whom God <S%H433><s%> has hedged <S%H9353><s%> in?
"For my groaning <S%H585><s%> comes <S%H935><s%> at the sight <S%H6440><s%> of my food, <S%H3899><s%> And my cries <S%H7581><s%> pour <S%H5413><s%> out like water. <S%H4325><s%>
"For what <S%H6343><s%> I fear <S%H6342><s%> comes <S%H857><s%> upon me, And what <S%H834><s%> I dread <S%H3025><s%> befalls <S%H935><s%> me.
"I am not at ease, <S%H7951><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> am I quiet, <S%H8252><s%> And I am not at rest, <S%H5117><s%> but turmoil <S%H7267><s%> comes. <S%H935><s%>"
